narrator: A floorboard creaks somewhere nearby.
The walls settle with a low groan.
Something taps against the window. Just the wind.
The pipes gurgle. Just plumbing. Probably.
A faucet drips somewhere. Steady. Rhythmic.
The ventilation hums a tuneless melody.

paul: Is Carl... humming? How can he be so cheerful?
I can hear Carl somewhere. He sounds happy. That's terrifying.

narrator: A shadow moves at the edge of vision. When you look, nothing's there.
Something shifts in the corner. Too fast to identify.
Was that a reflection? The light plays tricks in here.
A distant thud echoes through the walls.
Something heavy falls in another room. Then silence.
Footsteps? No. Just the building settling.
The temperature drops suddenly. Your breath mists in the air.
A cold draft from nowhere. The air tastes metallic.
carl: Brr! Getting chilly! Must be the ventilation. Or the spirits!
paul: Why is it suddenly cold? This isn't natural.

narrator: Something scrapes against the wall behind you.
Nails on metal. Or bone on stone. Hard to tell.
A slow, deliberate dragging sound from the other side of the wall.
A scream echoes from somewhere far away. Then cuts off abruptly.
carl: Did you hear that? Probably just the wind!
paul: That was a scream. That was definitely a scream.

narrator: Drip. Drip. Drip. Something red seeps from above.
A dark stain spreads slowly across the ceiling.
You're being watched. You can feel it.
Eyes in the darkness. Watching. Waiting. Patient.
paul: Something is watching me. I can feel it in my wool.
The hairs on my neck are standing up. All of them.

narrator: The lights flicker. In the darkness between flashes, something moves.
Power fluctuation. The shadows dance.
The air thickens. Reality feels thin here.
Something presses against the fabric of the world. Trying to get through.
The ground trembles. Just for a moment.
Everything shakes. Then stops. As if nothing happened.

carl: You know what they say, Paul â€” you can't make an omelette without breaking some... well, you know.
Art is subjective, Paul. MY art just uses unusual canvases.
I read somewhere that creativity requires sacrifice. I took that VERY literally.

paul: Every room I enter, I'm afraid of what I'll find.
How did I end up here? How does Carl keep DOING this?
I should have left when I had the chance. Any of the chances.

narrator: The kitchen smells like copper and cinnamon. An impossible combination.
carl: My kitchen! The sauce is simmering nicely. Want a taste?
paul: I'm NOT eating anything from this kitchen. Ever.

narrator: A food tray slides off the table by itself. Clatters to the floor.
carl: The self-cleaning system! I programmed it myself!
paul: The trays are still warm. How are the trays still warm?

narrator: A whisper from the darkness. Too quiet to understand. Too loud to ignore.
paul: Something just whispered my name. From the dark corner.

narrator: The cave echoes with sounds that have no source.
Water drips somewhere deep. Or is it water?
carl: Great acoustics in here! Perfect for my gallery's audio tour!

narrator: The tide brings in something. It's not seashells.
Waves lap at the shore. Each one slightly redder than the last.
The engine pulses. Like a heartbeat. Like something alive.
carl: Listen to that engine purr! I tuned it myself. Added organic components.
paul: The engine sounds... wrong. Like it's breathing.

narrator: A heart monitor beeps. There's no one connected to it.
Surgical instruments rattle on the tray. By themselves.
carl: The equipment is still calibrated! Very professional setup!

narrator: The undergrowth rustles. Something large moves through the jungle.
Branches crack in sequence, as if something is following the trail.
The ghost ship groans at its moorings. The ropes strain.
A porthole on the ship flickers with light. Then goes dark.
carl: The S.S. Carl is in excellent condition! I maintain it weekly!

narrator: A laugh echoes from somewhere. High-pitched. Wrong.
paul: Was that Carl laughing? What could possibly be funny right now?
